articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Tesla (TSLA.O) introduced new standard range Model S and Model X cars in the United States, priced at $78,490 and $88,490, respectively, the electric carmaker's website showed on Monday.
articles.title: Tesla introduces new Model S and X cars in US

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Crypto exchange Binance late on Monday filed for a protective court order against the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission saying the regulator's requests for information were "over broad" and "unduly burdensome".
articles.title: Binance files for protective order against SEC

articles.author: Nell Mackenzie
articles.description: Most investors still award bonuses to hedge funds even if their investments do not earn as much as a bank savings account would, Goldman Sachs (GS.N) said in a note to clients.
articles.title: Hedge funds land bonuses despite returns below bank savings rates -Goldman

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Russian rouble rose on Tuesday as investors bet the central bank would hike rates at an extraordinary policy meeting after the Russian currency tumbled past 101 per U.S. dollar on Monday and prompted a Kremlin call for tougher monetary policy.
articles.title: Russia's rouble rises ahead of central bank extraordinary meeting

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Home Depot (HD.N) on Tuesday reported a smaller-than-expected decline in quarterly same-store sales, as demand was buoyed by Americans spending on small-scale home-improvement projects amid signs of stabilization in the housing market.
articles.title: Home Depot reports smaller-than-expected drop in quarterly sales

articles.author: Dawn Chmielewski
articles.description: In what would be a sign of progress in a months-long labor dispute, striking Hollywood writers were expected to respond this week to the latest contract proposal from the major studios, according to two sources with knowledge of the talks.
articles.title: Striking Hollywood writers expected to respond to studios' proposal

articles.author: William Schomberg, Andy Bruce
articles.description: Basic wages in Britain hit a new record growth rate, figures showed on Tuesday, adding to worries for the Bank of England (BoE) about long-term inflation pressures even after 14 back-to-back increases in interest rates.
articles.title: UK basic wage growth hits record, adding to Bank of England's worries

articles.author: Jack Queen
articles.description: Donald Trump is likely to claim that his right to free speech and genuine concerns about voter fraud protect him from charges that he pressured Georgia officials to change the results of the 2020 election in his favor.
articles.title: Georgia indictment: How will Trump defend himself? Will it work?

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia's central bank hiked its key interest rate by 350 basis points to 12% on Tuesday, an emergency rate move to try and halt the rouble's weakening past 100 to the dollar after a public call from the Kremlin for tighter monetary policy.
articles.title: Russian central bank hikes rates by 350 bp to 12% in extraordinary meeting

articles.author: Daniela Desantis, Lucinda Elliott
articles.description: Paraguay's new president Santiago Pena takes office on Tuesday, a clean-cut economist for the conservative Colorado party who will need to juggle ties with Taiwan, pressure from farmers, rising crime and a U.S. probe into his political mentor.
articles.title: Santiago Pena, Paraguay's new president, faces tricky balancing act
